# asc cli

Unofficial CLI for Apple's App Store Connect API. This repository provides
`asc`, a fast, scriptable tool built for automation.

## What this tool is

- A single Go binary that automates App Store Connect workflows (TestFlight,
  builds, metadata, signing, submissions, analytics, etc.)
- JSON-first output (minified by default) for scripting
- Explicit flags (prefer `--app`, `--output`, etc.)
- No interactive prompts (destructive operations require `--confirm`)

## Where to start

- README: https://github.com/rudrankriyam/App-Store-Connect-CLI#readme
- Website docs: https://asccli.sh
- Command discovery: run `asc --help` and `asc <command> --help`

## Install

- Homebrew:
  - `brew tap rudrankriyam/tap`
  - `brew install rudrankriyam/tap/asc`
- Script:
  - `curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rudrankriyam/App-Store-Connect-CLI/main/install.sh | bash`

## Usage patterns

- Prefer JSON parsing:
  - `asc apps list | jq '.data[] | {id: .id, name: .attributes.name}'`
- Fetch all pages:
  - `asc apps list --paginate`
- Human output:
  - `asc builds list --app "APP_ID" --output table`

## Auth

`asc` supports App Store Connect API key authentication. Credentials can be
stored in the system keychain (when available) with a config and environment
variable fallback.

## Development pointers

- CLI style and agent guidance: `AGENTS.md` and `CLAUDE.md`
- Offline OpenAPI snapshot:
  - `docs/openapi/latest.json`
  - `docs/openapi/paths.txt`

## Repo keywords

App Store Connect, TestFlight, Xcode Cloud, code signing, provisioning profiles,
certificates, iOS, macOS, CI/CD, CLI, Go.
